column4: I spoke with Jerad on Sunday as he battled this virus. All too soon, he was taken from us.  Tammy and I extend our deepest condolences to Jenny and their young boys.

Please join me in prayer for @realDonaldTrump & @FLOTUS as they recover from COVID-19. Like so many Americans, the Trumps tested positive for the disease despite showing no symptoms. I have every hope their status will remain positive & they will both have a swift recovery.

I'm alarmed by the far-left policies @SpeakerPelosi continues to sneak into coronavirus relief bills, including anti-Second Amendment gun control measures.  Check out my thoughts on this in the @dcexaminer -->

I'm in DC this morning for today's vote on the new funds for #PPPloans, other SBA loans, & COVID-19 testing. I'm proud to support a clean bill w/ no unrelated policy riders. Our small biz owners needed action from us weeks ago, but I'm glad we're finally getting them this aid.
RT @tulsaworld: Coronavirus small business loans available soon, @SenatorLankford and @repkevinhern say https://t.co/P3vyCoD03a https://t.c…

#DearNancyPelosi, 

How do wind and solar tax credits (meant to harm the oil & gas industry my district relies on - but that's a topic for another day) help the workers losing their paychecks right now as a result of #Covid19?

#DearNancyPelosi, 

Why did you tank a bipartisan stimulus package that could have passed the House & been signed by @realdonaldtrump ASAP? Was it the direct cash to suffering Americans or the much-needed aid to medical workers on the frontlines of #Covid19 that put you off?

#DearNancyPelosi, 

The #GreenNewDeal was overwhelmingly shot down in the Senate last year. Why are you caving to a freshman socialist and sneaking GND provisions into what should be a #Covid19 relief package?

#DearNancyPelosi,

Where were you while the Senate worked day & night – with a strongly bipartisan task force – to create a stimulus package that provides aid directly to the people most impacted by #Covid19?

#DearNancyPelosi,

With #Covid19 spreading through our country, why do you want to divert $35 MILLION to the Kennedy Center in Washington, DC?

#DearNancyPelosi, 

What good does a bailout of the Post Office do to the millions of Americans out of work and suffering from #Covid19?

Proud to join @RepJimBanks @sethmoulton & a bipartisan coalition in the House as a cosponsor of this resolution condemning the Chinese Communist Party not only for misleading the world on #Covid19, but pushing blame on the US with a propaganda campaign.

In this fight against a global pandemic, we are all on the same side. Congress should be moving forward in agreement, but instead we are gridlocked in division.
This global pandemic requires swift action from Congress, but that does not mean we act in haste.

"We will eradicate the AIDS epidemic in America by the end of the decade." - @realDonaldTrump #SOTU
President Trump is addressing the rising costs of healthcare & pharmaceuticals in a way that will help the American people access excellent & affordable care. #SOTU https://t.co/2HfzeYm4tw
I look forward to hearing what the CBO Deputy Director has to say about the fatal impact of socialized healthcare (#MedicareForAll) on our economy and our people.
More than 1.7 million Oklahomans will lose their employer-sponsored insurance if the private health care market is eliminated with #MedicareForAll

#MedicareForAll not only doubles down on the dangerous practices that led us to this point, but will completely eliminate free-market competition from the health care market. 

(Refresher: free-market principles drive down costs, reward innovation, and encourage diversity)

In the years since, not only has that promise been broken, but premiums continue to skyrocket. Thousands of families cannot afford the burdensome costs of basic health care because of the government's interference in our health care system.
When the government got involved in health care 10 years ago, we were told "if you like your health care plan, you can keep it," a statement later ranked the #LieoftheYear by @PolitiFact

Capitalism and free-market principles have driven our country to the forefront in worldwide innovation, exceptionalism, and leadership. 

These free-market principles are the only way to keep health care costs affordable.

As I expected, Special Counsel Robert Mueller found no evidence of conspiracy or collusion between Russia and the Trump campaign. 

See my full statement here: https://t.co/86te1adukI https://t.co/duM2r3EB0f

The President is thinking ahead, rebuilding our fiscal health on a foundation of security instead of focusing on a quick fix. 

We can’t put this off for the next generation.
